phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Use this field to record the language in which the the creator record is written.
Use this field to record the repository responsible for creating the creator record.
Use this field to record the script in which the creator record is written.

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: Use this field to provide information about the organization or individual associated with the creation, assembly, accumulation and/or maintenance of the archival materials (DACS Chapter 10).
Use this field to record the name of the individual or individuals who created the biographical or historical note.
Use "Control Information" utility to record the language and script of the creator record.
Use this field to record additional information about creator[s].
Use this field to select and associate creator's relationship.
Use "Creator Notes" utility to record the biographical/historical notes and related information of the creator.
Use this field to select and associate a creator record.
Use this drop-down list to chose the authority from which the name is drawn. Additional authorities can be defined through the Creator Sources Manager.
This drop-down box provides a general list of creator types (e.g. corporate, personal, family). Select the most appropriate type for the creator being added or updated.
Use this field to record the year a creator was born and, optionally, died. Use a hypnen to separate the birth and death dates

Use the 'Creator Manager' to establish authority records for the creators of archival materials managed by the repository. Once an authorized entry has been established, it may be linked to a collections and/or digital objects by using the 'Creators' sections in the Collections and Digital Library Managers. See DACS Parts II and III for full instructions on describing Creators and constructing forms of names.
Enter a unique Control Identifier for the Creator Record.

Check 'yes' if the dates listed in the 'dates' field are the same as those listed in the Library of Congress Name Authority File. Also check yes if the format of the dates complies with the DACS and AACR2 rules for creating authority records, but an LC authority record does not exist for the creator listed in the names field.

If the dates listed in the 'dates' field are not the same as the LCNAF dates for the creator listed in the 'names' field, use this field to record the exist dates, EXACTLY as they are represented in tge associated LCNAF record.
Use this field to record the authorized entry for the creator being described. See the rules in DACS Chapters 11-14 for a fuller description of accepted name authority practices.
Use this field to record a more complete form of the name for a creator, only if the fuller form of the name is not included in the main creator field (DACS Rule 12.18).
Use this field to record other forms of a creators name that might be sought by a user, but which were not chosen as the authorized form of the name (DACS Rule 11.10).
Use this field to record the name of a corporate body related to the corporate body listed in the 'name' field (See DACS Rules 14.12-14.14).
Use this field to record information regarding citations and sources for information used to compile the administrative or biographical history. (See DACS Rule 10.4 for more information.)

phrasetype.name: Description
phrasetype.phrase: The information entered in this field will be encoded into the citation area of the EAC CPF.
Use this field to enter the name of a source from which creators may be drawn, e.g. "Library of Congress Name Authority File".
The information entered in this field will be encoded into the description area of the EAC CPF.

Use this field to enter the abbreviation for the source name. The value entered here will be used as the value of the 'source' attribute on the creator elements in the <origination> area of the EAD file being exported
